storyInfo: Horn is stymied by the colonel's people. Outcast is with Rhodes Island Operators making arrangements for a retreat, when she hears an unworldly sound from the sky. Bagpipe finds a Messenger, but right at that moment, the barracks commences a major bombardment of the city districts.

attributes.content: Given I'm here, all of you can come out now.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: How are my people?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Your subordinates are here. Rest assured, they're only unconscious.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: I don't mean Cello's group.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You know who I mean.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Don't push me, or it won't be my shield against your chin.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: *Cough*, *cough* *cough*... If you're going to draw your sword, you'll be attacking a colleague...
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Heh. Colleague?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: At what point, since the moment we entered County Hillock, have you ever treated us as colleagues?!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Answer me!!!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hff—
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Even supposing... you... cut my throat here... you can't alter... the Colonel's decision...
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You've never heard the degree of what the Tempest Platoon's soldiers can do, have you?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: How many did Triangle cost you? Half your own company?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It's just me alone here. But I guarantee you, you won't want to know how long it takes me to put you all to rights.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: L—Lay down your weapons!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Or else, w... we'll kill her on the spot!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: ...Cello.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I mean it! Make one move, and my crossbow's shooting straight through her neck!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You win.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Subdue her! Quickly, together now, we can't let her touch her sword and shield again!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Hill... you tell Hamilton...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Victoria is ashamed of him.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The Colonel has no need whatsoever for Victoria's gratitude.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Got the data all nice and pretty?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Yes, Lass, it's all in here.
attributes.name: Operator Fred

attributes.content: Wonderful.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I see Oliver's all done with the comms too.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Collaborating businesses have received notice. As per the agreement clauses, they can either seek an office in another city nearby, or terminate the contract.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: *Sigh*. Looking at it, these aren't losses for us to sneeze at.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Rhodes Island isn't the only company taking a hit in the chaos of war.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: True, no way around that. I just look at the chairs and tables in here and there's a twinge in my heart. This place of ours was still empty, back when I first came to County Hillock.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: A little early for separation anxiety, Oliver. How do you know we won't be right back, huh?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You're right. *Sigh*. I hope this city can return to the old peaceful everydays soon enough.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Storehouse medications, inventory finished.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: I need you to ration out these meds. Each one of you needs to bring enough emergency medication, make sure everyone makes it smoothly to the closest branch office.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: There's still a lot left over, sharing like that.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: There'll be some pressure if we take it all. We don't have that many hands, after all.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Shredder's quiet as ever, but I can tell, you have your own ideas.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: The people in the city... They need medicines.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Turns out I think so too. If this war scales up, everything's gonna be in short supply, especially Oripathy painkillers and suppressants that need to be taken long-term.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You must have a list of hospitals in the area?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Already sorted.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Think of a way to get it to them. No matter who these organizations serve, get as much as you can to all of them.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: And don't forget the little alley clinics. Plenty of them out there without signs, but a lot of our friends around here rely on them.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Lass, is this really proper? We never bypass local healthcare, directly providing medical organizations and individuals with pharmaceuticals.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Desperate times call for desperate measures. And it's not like a hospital's gonna refuse an 'anonymous donation' from concerned citizens, right?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: True! So you got it all figured out, eh. But then, who'll take charge of sending it? The people around all know we're Rhodes Islanders.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: I will... I can help Shredder parcel the medicine, and then I'll deliver it.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Jane, you all better?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: My wounds aren't bleeding anymore.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You know I'm not asking about the wounds.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I didn't want to be tucked alone in a corner crying while you were all bustling about.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I'm glad you can help, but we've got a lot of meds here.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Please, trust a Vouivre's stamina.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I just don't want Rhodes Island work getting in the way of your own plans.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: It's alright. From here to the zone of battle, there just so happens to be plenty of hospitals and clinics along the way.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Once I'm done delivering, I'll rejoin you.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Just a little left. We'll be done with wrapping in no time.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Then it's about time we got on our way.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: As Outcast speaks, she draws a revolver from the holster at her side.
Whoa. That's your gun?
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: That it is.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: For a Sankta, pre-op prep's only complete once your gun's loaded.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: It doesn't look like your chamber's full.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Under normal circumstances, five rounds is enough to do the trick.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: When I was back at the landship and ate with Barty's group, I heard a lot of stories from the field about you.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: You once took down three Columbian bandits with a single bullet, and used three to scatter a whole mercenary team.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: If I had to guess, there wouldn't be an enemy out there worth six straight shots?
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Can't say for sure. After all, there's always a bigger beast.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: But I made a promise to someone that I'd never fire a sixth round lightly—because we made a bet.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I can't help but be curious. What kind of bet would make someone like you change up how you work?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: That's a long story.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: The short version is that friend of mine tried every way under the sun to show me an easy retirement.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: And I always had a feeling that even if I retired for real, someone like me just couldn't live peaceful.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Like right now?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I never imagined County Hillock could turn so restless. It was just a day or two ago, we were all huddled together playing cards and drinking tea...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: A lot of times, a situation's like the color of the sky, shifting on and on.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: If it's up to me, I'd sure like this retreat operation to go nice and quiet-like. Best case scenario, I don't even need to fire one round.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: ...Lass, it's all ready.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Friends, it's time to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Janie...
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: You don't need to be so sad, Uncle Oliver. I trust in what Outcast says—we can surely see each other again!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Jane, be careful.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: I will, Shredder. All of you too, be sure to take care of yourselves.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Oh... did I hear thunder?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: ...It'll be raining soon enough.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: No. Something's not right about that sound. Jane, stay inside for now!
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Mr. Chef, Mr. Chef, are you here?!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Agh! Yes, I'm here, I'm here! Stop it with the banging! There's too much lampblack on our office door. Can't stand up to knocks.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Okay, good, you're still here... here's the thing, I need a Messenger, we've got important information that needs sendin' out!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Yeah, I understand. Fancy that, I've got something to give to you too.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Eh? What's this? A piece of... paper?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's a list of stationed officers—the one named Louis Kelly, he just handed it to me.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Captain Kelly? How'd he get in touch with you?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Relax, he's got no clue who I am. It was only 'cause I was the last person he ran into.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: I was going to go poking around for the latest. Still remember my actual job, after all... Didn't imagine I'd run into the troops arresting him!
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Arrestin'... him? You mean, Captain Kelly's been arrested by his own?!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They said he was harboring Oripathics! But that can't be right. His son passed from Oripathy a few months ago, the whole city knows that. The first thing he did was report the news his son'd gotten ill!
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: These people... usin' such a tragic illness as an excuse? That's beyond shameless!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Not just once or twice, either. For people wanting to use any form of discrimination as a front, it's true, Oripathy is an especially good pretense.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Just take this time. The troops are weeding out any inside people born Taran.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Officers or soldiers, so long as they were kindred with Tarans in some way, were stripped overnight of any right to act freely.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Clearin' out the barracks' Tarans? In wartime, pressed for people? I've got an awful feelin' about this already.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: So, Captain Kelly slipped me this like his life depended on it, wanted me to give it to 'the soldier not from this barracks who's constantly been hanging around here as of late'—
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Mr. Chef, this is proof the barracks are makin' illegal Originium weapons!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What?! Hamilton's lost his mind!
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: I want you to find a trustworthy Messenger, give 'em this paper and our report about the spectre force both, to be treated as vital intelligence, and taken out of County Hillock straight away!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: This is the Captain's endeavor in his final moment! We cannot waste it!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Can't do that. This information's too important, and we can't rely on a civilian Messenger. How about this instead, Miss—I'll make this trip myself.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Mr. Chef, you were a Messenger too?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Don't forget, passing on information's part of us lamplighters' profession too. Ah, finally, I can take on a decent assignment at long last. Excitement's got my hands and legs shaking.
attributes.name: Messenger MacMartin

attributes.content: Wait, hold on, there's some sound outside...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's lightning, isn't it?
attributes.name: Messenger MacMartin

attributes.content: I'm feelin' doubtful about that.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's fine, I've been here in County Hillock how many years now. The weather changes when it wants to. Used to it at this point.
attributes.name: Messenger MacMartin

attributes.content: A little lightning and rain can't hold me back! I'm off!
attributes.name: Messenger MacMartin

attributes.text: The Messenger charges into the recess of the street with nary a look back.
On his head, a hard rain is pouring down, and the thunder gradually nears, getting concentrated, louder—

attributes.content: This... this isn't lightning!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No, Mr. Chef—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: —This is bombardment!!!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.text: The Messenger isn't in time to hear her words.
Countless shells come down with the rain, exploding the moment they contact the ground and walls.

The blast waves tear effortlessly through the gel material, blisteringly and ferociously melting the metal makeup, but the more fearsome thing takes advantage of the illness that bores beneath the city's muscle and bone—

Incomplete combustion sees immense formations of Originium crystal, solidifying dense within the open wounds of streets and buildings, as if in the dirty rain, identically and rapidly, bloom pure black flowers.
